intro: Tubella chamaelepanthes, commonly known as the rock violet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the stems. Tubella chamaelepanthes is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in challenging garden conditions.
